title: a historic temple.........very nice experience
review: very nice old temple......must visit during stay in pushkar. we visted this temple which was a suggestion from a local guide......you may use camel to reach this temple .......pujari had given us information about history.

title: bast in india
review: im enjoying here it is so peace and cool it is undergraund verry clean i recomended to see this tempal

title: aptaeshwar
review: mazedaar place as one of the famous temples  ,old one gud one must see its located in the heart of pushkar and sprituality felt there,

title: Full of positive aura
review: I personally liked this place a lot. It's full of positive aura. The breeze, the calm environment, the birds chirping. It's amazing.

title: Sublime experience at this sacred temple
review: The temple is close to the Sri Varaha temple...Shiva ling is at the underground reached 10 steps downstairs from the road...statue is huge with a copper snake around the Shiv ling...there are also statues of Uma & Maheshwar along with Ganesh and Kartikeya with the Holy Bull - Nandi...sanctum sanctorum is small and one can sit outside and do the prayers...don't miss it

title: Advisable on a religious trip
review: This place is for the religious folks out there seeking blessings and who are on a religious trip to Pushkar. We dropped in for a quick visit and did not find anything out of the ordinary.

title: Pretty common
review: The temple is located almost on main market road. It is one of the oldest (constructed in the 12th century), famous and honored in Pushkar, although in the past it was destroyed so much times. Now this is actually an underground sanctuary with the lingam with a huge snake made of copper. Nothing outstanding in aesthetic terms in the aboveground part of the temple, everything there is pretty common.

title: Aptaeshwar Temple
review: Aptaeshwar Temple is a great temple for viewing it SC nun Jesuit cubby hungry it buy rest in all the time

title: Good temple to visit
review: This is a nice temple to visit. Especially spiritual and religious people need to visit this temple.

title: Shiva...
review: One of the oldest temple in city with it's own stories...  Elived to be natural lingam whereas the temple constructed in 12th century.

title: Temple of Lord Shiva
review: It is like other shiva temples in any town. Nothing much to describe/see. Tourists may go and can have a darshan but i found that it is not a compulsory.

title: Deep in the earth of Pushkar
review: I was in Pushkar on Mahashivaratri and went to several Shiva temples here.  Most had only a few worshippers, despite beautiful four faced lingams.  However, there was one that had a long line of pilgrims.  It is nondescript and hard to find, just a narrow door that goes down steep steps.  There is a long narrow hallway carved into the earth that leads to a small, 10X10 tiled room with a large lingam wrapped in a copper naga. Nothing to look at, BUT the devotional intensity of the worship was as sincere as any I've seen in India. People waited patiently while chanting for over an hour in the hot, humid tunnel just to get to the lingam and make offerings and receive darshan.  (be sure to take an offering) They were welcoming to me as a non-Indian, and there was something about being deep underground, under Pushkar in this tiny ancient room with its lingam that has really stuck in my imaginative and devotional landscape.

title: A place where you feel the religion
review: We were in this Temple in November 2012. Unlike most of the other Pushkat temple where non-indians are banned, we were welcomed in this place. It's a underground shrine, where people take the offerings to a huge Shiva Lingam. I suggest this place as I felt it more like a religious spot where people were praying than an attraction.
